    46. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

            
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                break_in_teaching_period.save!
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                break_in_teaching_period
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              def week_number(date)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                # Calcualte date offset, add 2 so 0-week offset is week 1 not week 0
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                result = ((date - start_date) / 1.week).floor + 1
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

            
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                for a_break in breaks.all do
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  if date >= a_break.start_date
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                    # we are in or after the break, so calculated week needs to
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                    # be reduced by this break
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                    if date >= a_break.end_date
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                      # past the end of the break...
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                      result -= a_break.number_of_weeks
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                    elsif date == a_break.start_date
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                      # cant use standard calculation as this give 0 for this exact moment...
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                      result -= 1 if date >= a_break.first_monday
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                    elsif date >= a_break.first_monday
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                      # in break so partial reduction
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                      result -= ((date - a_break.first_monday) / 1.week).ceil
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

            
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                    # for times just past the break but before start of next week...
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                    if date >= a_break.end_date && date < a_break.monday_after_break
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                      # Need to add 1 as we are now in a new week!
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                      result += 1
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                result
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

            
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

              def date_for_week(num)
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                num = num.floor
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

            
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                # start by switching from 1 based to 0 based
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                # week 1 is offset 0 weeks from the start
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                num -= 1
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

            
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                result = start_date + num.weeks
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                # check breaks
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                for a_break in breaks do
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  if result >= a_break.start_date
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                    # we are in or after the break, so calculated date is
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                    # extended by the break period
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                    result += a_break.number_of_weeks.weeks
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

            
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                result
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

            
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

              def date_for_week_and_day(week, day)
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                return nil if week.nil? || day.nil?
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

            
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                week_start = date_for_week(week)
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

            
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                day_num = Date::ABBR_DAYNAMES.index day.titlecase
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                return nil if day_num.nil?
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

            
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                start_day_num = start_date.wday
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

            
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                result = week_start + (day_num - start_day_num).days
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

            
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                for a_break in breaks do
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  if result >= a_break.start_date && result < a_break.end_date
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                    # we are in or after the break, so calculated date is
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                    # extended by the break period
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                    result += a_break.number_of_weeks.weeks
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

            
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                result
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

            
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

              def future_teaching_periods
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                TeachingPeriod.where("start_date > :end_date", end_date: end_date)
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

            
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

              def rollover(rollover_to, search_forward=true,rollover_inactive=false)
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                if rollover_to.start_date < Time.zone.now || rollover_to.start_date <= start_date
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  self.errors.add(:base, "Units can only be rolled over to future teaching periods")
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

            
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                  false
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  units_to_rollover = units
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  unless rollover_inactive
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                    units_to_rollover = units_to_rollover.where(active: true)
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

            
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  if search_forward
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                    ftp = future_teaching_periods.where("start_date < :date", date: rollover_to.start_date).order(start_date: "desc")
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

            
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                    units_to_rollover = units_to_rollover.map do |u|
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                      ftp.map{|tp| tp.units.where(code: u.code).first }.select{|u| u.present?}.first || u
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

            
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  for unit in units_to_rollover do
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                    #skip if the unit already exists in the teaching period
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                    next if rollover_to.units.where(code: unit.code).count > 0
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

            
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                    unit.rollover(rollover_to, nil, nil)
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

            
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  true
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

            
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

              private
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

              def can_destroy?
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                return true if units.count == 0
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                errors.add :base, "Cannot delete teaching period with units"
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                throw :abort
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

            
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

              def validate_active_until_after_end_date
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                if end_date.present? && active_until.present? && active_until < end_date
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  errors.add(:active_until, "date should be after the End date")
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

            
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

              def validate_end_date_after_start_date
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                if end_date.present? && start_date.present? && end_date < start_date
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  errors.add(:end_date, "should be after the Start date")
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

            
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

              def propogate_date_changes
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                return unless saved_change_to_start_date? || saved_change_to_end_date?
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

            
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                units.each do |u|
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  u.update(start_date: self.start_date, end_date: self.end_date)
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

            end

            class Tutorial < ApplicationRecord
          
      2.

              # Model associations

              belongs_to :unit, optional: false # Foreign key
          
      4.

              belongs_to :unit_role, optional: true # Foreign key

              belongs_to :campus, optional: true

              belongs_to :tutorial_stream, optional: true

              # Make sure that unit in tutorial and tutorial stream are consistent

              validate :unit_must_be_same

              def unit_must_be_same

                if unit.present? and tutorial_stream.present? and ! unit.eql? tutorial_stream.unit

              def self.default
          
      30.

                tutorial = new

                tutorial.unit_role_id     = -1
          
      33.

                tutorial.meeting_day      = 'Enter a regular meeting day.'

                tutorial.meeting_time     = 'Enter a regular meeting time.'

                tutorial.meeting_location = 'Enter a location.'

                tutorial

              def self.find_by_user(user)

              def assign_tutor(tutor_user)

              def num_students

      79.

                return true if active_enrolment_count == 0 && groups.count == 0

              def ensure_max_one_tutorial_enrolment_per_stream

              def ensure_only_one_tutorial_per_stream

              def must_be_in_group_tutorials
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                project.groups.each do |g|
          
      88.

                  next unless g.limit_members_to_tutorial?
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  next if tutorial_id == g.tutorial_id
          
      90.

      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  if g.group_set.allow_students_to_manage_groups
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                    # leave group
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                    g.remove_member(project)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                    errors.add(:groups, "require #{project.student.name} to be in tutorial #{g.tutorial.abbreviation}")
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                    break
          
      97.

            class TutorialStream < ApplicationRecord
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

              belongs_to :activity_type, optional: false
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            
            

            

              belongs_to :unit, optional: false
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

              # Callbacks - methods called are private
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

              after_create :handle_associated_task_defs
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              before_destroy :can_destroy?, prepend: true
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              has_many :tutorials, dependent: :destroy
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              has_many :task_definitions, -> { order 'start_date ASC, abbreviation ASC' }
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

            
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

              validates :unit, presence: true
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

              validates :activity_type, presence: true
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

            
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

              # Always add a unique index with uniqueness constraint
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              # This is to prevent new records from passing the validations when checked at the same time before being written
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

              validates :name,         presence: true, uniqueness: { scope: :unit, message: "%{value} already exists in this unit"}
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

              validates :abbreviation, presence: true, uniqueness: { scope: :unit, message: "%{value} already exists in this unit"}
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

            
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              def self.find_by_abbr_or_name(data)
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                TutorialStream.find_by(abbreviation: data) || TutorialStream.find_by(name: data)
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

            
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              private
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              def can_destroy?
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                return true if task_definitions.empty?
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                if unit.tutorial_streams.count > 2
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  errors.add :base, "cannot be deleted as it has task definitions associated with it, and it is not the last (or second last) tutorial stream"
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  throw :abort
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                elsif unit.tutorial_streams.count.eql? 2
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  other_tutorial_stream = (self.eql? unit.tutorial_streams.first) ? unit.tutorial_streams.second : unit.tutorial_streams.first
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  task_definitions.update_all(tutorial_stream_id: other_tutorial_stream.id)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  task_definitions.clear
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                  true
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                elsif unit.tutorial_streams.count.eql? 1
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  # Removes all objects from the collection by removing their associations from the join table
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                  task_definitions.clear
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                  true
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

            
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

              def handle_associated_task_defs
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                return if unit.task_definitions.empty? or unit.tutorial_streams.count > 1
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                if unit.task_definitions.exists? and unit.tutorial_streams.count.eql? 1
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  unit.task_definitions.update_all(tutorial_stream_id: id)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      49.

    app/models/unit.rb

    1949 relevant lines. 0 lines covered and 1949 lines missed.

              def role_for(user)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                if convenors.where('unit_roles.user_id=:id', id: user.id).count == 1
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  Role.convenor
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                elsif tutors.where('unit_roles.user_id=:id', id: user.id).count == 1
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  Role.tutor
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                elsif active_projects.where('projects.user_id=:id', id: user.id).count == 1
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  Role.student
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                elsif user.has_admin_capability?
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  Role.admin
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  nil
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

            
          
      102.

              # Ensure before destroy is above relations - as this needs to clear main convenor before unit roles are deleted

              after_update :propogate_date_changes_to_tasks, if: :saved_change_to_start_date?

              # Model associations.
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

              # When a Unit is destroyed, any TaskDefinitions, Tutorials, and ProjectConvenor instances will also be destroyed.
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

              has_many :projects, dependent: :destroy # projects first to remove tasks
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

              has_many :active_projects, -> { where enrolled: true }, class_name: 'Project'
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

              has_many :group_sets, dependent: :destroy # group sets next to remove groups
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

              has_many :task_definitions, -> { order 'start_date ASC, abbreviation ASC' }, dependent: :destroy
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

              has_many :tutorials, dependent: :destroy # tutorials need groups and tasks deleted before it...
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

              has_many :tutorial_streams, dependent: :destroy
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

              has_many :unit_roles, dependent: :destroy
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

              has_many :learning_outcomes, dependent: :destroy
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

              has_many :comments, through: :projects
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

            
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122.

    131.

      132.

      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

              validates :code, uniqueness: { scope: :teaching_period, message: "%{value} already exists in this teaching period" }, if: :has_teaching_period?
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

              validates :extension_weeks_on_resubmit_request, :numericality => { :greater_than_or_equal_to => 0 }
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151.

              validate :validate_end_date_after_start_date

              validate :ensure_main_convenor_is_appropriate
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

              scope :current,               -> { current_for_date(Time.zone.now) }
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

              scope :current_for_date,      ->(date) { where('start_date <= ? AND end_date >= ?', date, date) }
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

              scope :not_current,           -> { not_current_for_date(Time.zone.now) }
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

              scope :not_current_for_date,  ->(date) { where('start_date > ? OR end_date < ?', date, date) }
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

              scope :set_active,            -> { where('active = ?', true) }
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

              scope :set_inactive,          -> { where('active = ?', false) }
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

              def docker_image_name_tag
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                return nil if overseer_image.nil?
